ch.unibe.iam.graph.misc
Class GraphGenerator

java.lang.Object
  ch.unibe.iam.graph.misc.GraphGenerator
public final class GraphGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides several methods for creating new instances of special graphs.

Version:
$Revision: 1.24 $ $Date: 2003/08/08 09:25:23 $
Author:
Pascal Habegger

Method Detail

completeGraph

public static Graph completeGraph(int pCntVcs)
Generates a new complete undirected graph on the specified number of vertices. If the new graph has to contain n vertices, n * (n - 1) / 2 have to be generated.

Parameters:
pCntVcs - Number of vertices of the new complete graph.
Returns:
Complete undirected graph on pCntVcs vertices.

createStar

public static Graph createStar(int pCntVcs)
Creates a star topology of the specified size.

Parameters:
pCntVcs - Number of vertices of the new graph.
Returns:
Undirected graph of pCntVcs vertices as a star topology.

createLinearGraph

public static Graph createLinearGraph(int pCntVcs,
                                      boolean pIsClosed,
                                      boolean pIsDirected)
Creates a focus graph, optionally closed. No edges will be created, if pCntVcs < 2; otherwise pCntVcs edges will be created if graph is closed, else pCntVcs - 1.

createGridGraph

public static Graph createGridGraph(int pSize)
Creates a (two-dimensional) grid graph (no wraparound).

createLinearBus

public static Graph createLinearBus(int pCntVcs,
                                    boolean pIsDirected)
Creates a linear bus topology of the specified size.

Parameters:
pCntVcs - Number of vertices of the new graph.
pIsDirected - true if graph is directed, otherwise false.
Returns:
Undirected graph of pCntVcs vertices as a linear bus.

createRing

public static Graph createRing(int pCntVcs,
                               boolean pIsDirected)
Creates a ring topology of the specified size.

Parameters:
pCntVcs - Number of vertices of the new ring.
pIsDirected - true if graph is directed, otherwise false.
Returns:
Un-/directed graph of pCntVcs vertices as a ring.

create1LatticeGraph

public static Graph create1LatticeGraph(int pCntVcs,
                                        int pDegree)
Creates a 1-lattice graph of the specified size.

Parameters:
pCntVcs - Number of vertices of the new graph.
pDegree - Degree of each node in this 1-lattice graph; must be even.
Returns:
Undirected graph of pCntVcs vertices as a lattice graph.

createRandomGraph

public static Graph createRandomGraph(int pNumVcs,
                                      int pNumEds,
                                      boolean pIsDirected)
Generates a new random graph containing the specified number of vertices and edges.

Parameters:
pNumVcs - Number of vertices of the new random graph.
pNumEds - Number of edges of the new random graph.
pIsDirected - true if new graph should be directed, or false if undirected.
Returns:
Random graph of appropriate size.

createMessmerRandomGraph

public static Graph createMessmerRandomGraph(boolean pDirected,
                                             boolean pConnected,
                                             int pNumberVertices,
                                             int pAverageNumberEdges,
                                             int pNumberVertexLabels,
                                             int pNumberEdgeLabels)
Generates a labelled (edges and vertices) random graph as used by messmer. The labels are integer values. The number of labels is specified by the caller. The generator randomly picks a label from the label set. A label may be picked several times, therefore not all labels need to be assigned.

Parameters:
pDirected - True to create a directed graph, false otherwise
pConnected - True to make the graph connected, false otherwise
pNumberVertices - The number of vertices to be created
pAverageNumberEdges - The average number of edges per vertex in the graph
pNumberVertexLabels - Number of different vertex labels (only one label is assigned to a vertex, not all labels need to be assigned)
pNumberEdgeLabels - Number of different edge labels (only one label is assigned to an edge, not all labels need to be assigned)
Returns:
Random graph

createDLatticeGraph

public static Graph createDLatticeGraph(int[] pDim,
                                        int[] pDegree)
Creates a d-lattice graph of the specified size.

Parameters:
pDegree - Degree per dimension of each node in this lattice graph; must be even.
pDim - dimension of graph. The number of vertices in the graph is implicitly given by this parameter.
Returns:
Undirected graph of pCntVcs vertices as a lattice graph.

createHyperCube

public static Graph createHyperCube(int pDim,
                                    int pEdgeLength)
Creates a n-dimensional hybercube. Edges are wrap-around since the method is based on the createDLatticeGraph method.

Parameters:
pDim - dimension of cube
pEdgeLength - number of vertices in one dimension of the hypercube
Returns:
hypercube graph

createHyperCuboid

public static Graph createHyperCuboid(int[] pDim)
Creates a n-dimensional hybercuboid. Edges are wrap-around since the method is based on the createDLatticeGraph method.

Parameters:
pDim - int[]-array with the lengths of a direction i stored in pDim[i]
Returns:
hypercuboid graph

addRandomLabels

public static void addRandomLabels(Graph pG,
                                   int pNumberVertexLabels,
                                   int pNumberEdgeLabels,
                                   java.lang.String pLabelKey,
                                   boolean pReplaceExistingLabel)
Adds random labels/attributes (java.lang.Integer) to a graphs vertices and edges. The labels can be retrieved using the "IntAttrib"-key with the Vertex.getAttribute(String key) or Edge.getAttribute(String key) method.

Parameters:
pG - the graph to be labelled
pNumberVertexLabels - Number of different vertex labels (only one label is assigned to a vertex, not all labels need to be assigned)
pNumberEdgeLabels - Number of different edge labels (only one label is assigned to an edge, not all labels need to be assigned)

addWiring

public static void addWiring(Graph pG,
                             double pWirePercentage)
Adds wiring to the graph pG. Additional edges are introduced (random head/tail node). However, no self-loops, multiedges or, in directed graphs, edges of the kind e1(head,tail) and e2(tail,head) are introduced.

Parameters:
pG - the graph to be wired
pWirePercentage - specifies the number of edges to be introduced as a percentage of the number of nodes in the graph (i.e. the graph contains 10 nodes, pWirePercentage=0.2 => 2 additional edges are introduced).

reWiring

public static void reWiring(Graph pG,
                            double pWirePercentage)
Rewires the graph pG. Edges are moved (random head/tail node). However, no self-loops, multiedges or, in directed graphs, edges of the kind e1(head,tail) and e2(tail,head) are introduced.

Parameters:
pG - the graph to be wired
pWirePercentage - specifies the number of edges to be moved as a percentage of the number of nodes in the graph (i.e. the graph contains 10 nodes, pWirePercentage=0.2 => 2 edges are moved).

getRandomGenerator

public static final MersenneTwisterFast getRandomGenerator()
Returns an instance of the random generator Mersenne Twister.

Returns:
Instance of Mersenne Twister.

getInducedSubgraphs

public static Graph[] getInducedSubgraphs(Graph pGraph)
Creates induced subgraphs by choosing every node combination possible cutting the remaining nodes.

Parameters:
pGraph -
Returns:
an array containing induced subgraphs

getPartialSubgraphs

public static Graph[] getPartialSubgraphs(Graph pGraph)
Creates partial subgraphs by choosing every edge combination possible cutting the remaining edges.

Parameters:
pGraph -
Returns:
an array containing induced subgraphs
